name: Avoid using CALL METHOD without error handling
description:
This rule searches for ABAP artifacts that contain calls to class methods without error handling. 
If the method manages exceptions, then these should be referenced in the CALL METHOD and SY-SUBRC variable should be tested after. 
Syntax <obj>->meth is also supported.
The rule takes in account the following cases:
- Use of a temporary variable

CALL METHOD zzz.

Tmp = SY-SUBRC.

IF Tmp NE 0.
    list of statements
END-IF.

- Use of WRITE statement before return code checking

CALL METHOD zzz.

WRITE: / Do some testing.

IF SY-SUBRC NE 0.
    list of statements
END-IF.
output:
Associated to each ABAP artifact in violation, the Quality Rule provides: 
- The number of calls to class methods without error handling
- Bookmarks for violation patterns found in source code: 
  - CALL METHOD without error handling
rationale: Class methods can generate exceptions to manage abnormal situations. It is strongly recommended to reference these exceptions when calling methods and to test the SY-SUBRC system symbol to address these situations. If the caller does not handle an exception triggered by a method, then the current program terminates.
remediation:
Add references to exceptions in CALL METHOD statements if the called method implements some. 
Insert a test of the SY-SUBRC system symbol after each CALL METHOD statement that reference exceptions.
remediationSample:
CLASS C1 DEFINITION. 
  PUBLIC SECTION. 
  METHODS M1 EXCEPTIONS EX1 
  EX2. 
ENDCLASS. 
... 
FORM MY-FORM. 
  DATA O1 TYPE REF TO C1. 

  CREATE OBJECT O1. 

  CALL METHOD O1->M1 
    EXCEPTIONS 
      EX1 = 10 
      EX2 = 20. 

  CASE SY-SUBRC. 
    WHEN 10. 
    ... 
    WHEN 20. 
    ... 
  ENDCASE. 
ENDFORM.
